[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Publications Management System (PMS) defines requirements for guiding development, testing, and project management.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: PMS enables publication management, allowing users to search, download, and upload content.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: PMS integrates with MySQL databases and web servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: PMS provides web-based and CLI access.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: PMS supports browsers and server technologies.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: PMS ensures secure data exchange using TCP/IP.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: PMS efficiently handles large publication databases.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: PMS supports continuous online access and maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: PMS runs on Linux-based systems with Ruby.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: PMS integrates with cloud-based publication services.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: PMS enables publication search, user management, and uploads.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: PMS serves admins, members, and guests with different access levels.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: PMS requires internet, compatible browsers, and media-capable hardware.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: PMS requires a stable web server, internet, and compatible OS.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Guest:  User who can register or log in.
VUB-Network User:  User with IP-based access.
Member:  User with publication search and download rights.
Publisher:  User who uploads and manages content.
Moderator:  Publisher with extended content review rights.
Administrator:  User with full system control.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall provide web access through standard browsers.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall allow CLI access for administrators.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall allow users to search for publications (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall allow users to download publications (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow publishers to upload content (REQ-INTF-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide an intuitive interface for searching and browsing.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall return search results promptly for up to roughly a thousand publications.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store publications and user data in MySQL.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall follow modular architecture for scalability.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall comply with web standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with ISO 27001 security standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-002: The system shall adhere to WCAG 2.1 accessibility guidelines.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall be portable and log errors for troubleshooting.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Functional testing will validate search, upload, and download features, while performance testing ensures efficiency.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: User manuals, system guides, and documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO 27001, W3C XHTML standards, and MySQL documentation.
